page.title: 11AGRICULTURE AROUND BROMYARD
page.content: The afternoon routine,especially in the winter,is to muck-out the livestock. The rest of the afternoon is spent doing maintenance and repairs around the farm. The two 24-hours-a-day, 7-days-a- week jobs, are the lambing in the Spring and the harvesting which takes place in the latter part of the Summer. In 1968, 16 more acres were bought in addition to the fifty original acres from the mid-1700s. The most interesting change over the years has been the change from shire-horses to modern machinery. Mr Manzoni considers that his farm is profitable, in the sense that he earns enough to keep his family going, but not enough to expand his farm. All his capital is invested in the farm.
